column3: $Lopez homered from both sides of the plate

$Clark homered from both sides of the plate; Clark and Lopez become the second pair of teammates to each switch hit homers in one game; Bernie Williams and Jorge Posada performed the feat as Yankees on 4/23/2000
$Justin Upton called for interference

$pitcher Haren caught line drive and threw to 2B Lopez, who walked over and tagged runner Pierre; Ethier did not tag up on the play and crossed the plate before the third out was made at 2B; the DBacks left the field and the umpires ruled that Ethier crossed the plate before the third out, which is a timing play; the umpires further told the managers that, if the Dbacks had appealed at 3B before leaving the field, then Ethier would have been the '4th out' of the inning (rule 7.10 (d)) and his out would have replaced Pierre's, thus negating the run
Cardinals pitcher Chris Carpenter left the game due to an injured back
Rockies pitcher Franklin Morales left the game due to an injured neck/shoulder

replay,3,byrne001,ARI,crawj901,PHO01,O,N,I,,H $Eric Byrne's fly hit the top of the LF wall and bounced back onto the field; DBacks manager Bob Melvin thought it hit the pole behind the wall for a home run; crew chief Jerry Crawford watched the replay and upheld the call as a ball in play
originally scored E5, changed next day to S5
Debut game for Esmerling Vasquez
$Line drive caught on short hop. Runner tagged at 3rd in case it was caught. Kearns threw home and Flores stretched like a first baseman to complete the play as Lopez dove for the plate
Debut game for Bryan Augenstein
Debut game for Gerardo Parra

ej,hundn001,P,coope901,Call at HP on force out ej,blacb001,M,coope901,Call at HP $HP umpire Eric Cooper ruled that Padres catcher Nick Hundley had taken his foot off the plate before catching the throw from Adrian Gonzalez; Hundley argued and was ejected by Cooper; Padres manager Bud Black was also ejected by Cooper for arguing
Debut game for Daniel Schlereth
Braves first baseman Casey Kotchman left the game due to an injured leg
originally scored as 3-base error, changed to triple next day
Astros third baseman Geoff Blum left the game due to an injured leg
Astros left fielder Carlos Lee left the game due to an injured leg
Diamondbacks left fielder Eric Byrnes left the game due to an injured hand/wrist
$Felipe Lopez called for interference
Debut game for Ryan Webb
Marlins pitcher Burke Badenhop left the game due to an injured knee
Phillies center fielder Shane Victorino left the game due to an injured knee

replay,8,parrg001,ARI,cousd901,PHO01,O,N,I,,H $the ball hit the top of the RF fence on the yellow padding and bounced up and back onto the field; the ball was ruled in play but Diamondbacks manager A.J. Hinch asked about it; crew chief Derryl Cousins watched the replay and upheld the call
Debut game for Rusty Ryal
$originally scored E6, changed to single next day

ej,raucj001,P,everm901,Balls and strikes ej,hinca001,M,everm901,Balls and strikes (after Rauch ejection $Diamondbacks pitcher Jon Rauch talked to HP umpire Mike Everitt after the inning ended, arguing a call on a close pitch; Rauch was ejected by Everitt; DBacks manager A.J. Hinch was also ejected by Everitt

$Rusty Ryals' line drive struck Dodgers pitcher Hiroki Kuroda on the side of the head, bounced on the warning track behind the Diamondbacks on deck circle and hopped into the stands; Kuroda fell to the ground holding his head; he was carried off the field with his neck immobilized and taken to the hospital with an apparent concussion but no more serious injuries
Debut game for Wilton Lopez
Debut game for John Hester
$Diamondbacks pitcher Chad Qualls twisted in an attempt to catch the comebacker; he fell to the ground with a dislocated left kneecap, which was popped back in by the trainer

ej,ramim002,P,eddid901,Balls and strikes $Dodgers left fielder Manny Ramirez objected to the first called strike after swinging at strike three; he threw his bat toward the Dodgers dugout and then threw his helmet in the same direction; he was ejected by HP umpire Doug Eddings
Giants second baseman Freddy Sanchez left the game due to an injured knee

replay,3,parrg001,ARI,bellw901,PHO01,O,Y,I,,H $the fly ball by Gerardo Parra struck the chain link portion of the fence in the deepest part of right center field; 1B umpire Marty Foster called the ball a home run but the umpires immediately gathered in the infield; acting crew chief Wally Bell watched the replay and overturned the call to a ball in play; he awarded Parra a double and allowed the runner from first, Miguel Montero, to score

replay,6,ryalr001,ARI,bellw901,PHO01,O,N,I,,H $the fly ball by Rusty Ryal struck the chain link portion of the fence in the deepest part of right center field - in the same spot as the previous night's hit by Gerardo Parra; the hit was called in play but the umpires huddled and then acting crew chief Wally Bell watched the replay and upheld the call
Debut game for Ernesto Frieri

replay,6,tracc001,ARI,reedr901,PHO01,I,N,I,,H $Padres center fielder Tony Gwynn leaped for the ball but a fan touched it, preventing Gwynn from attempting the catch; since the fan did not lean out over the field, it was ruled a home run, even though Gwynn might have been able to catch the ball over the wall; crew chief Rick Reed watched the replay and upheld the call
